text:
"God's Plan" is a song recorded by Canadian musician Drake. It was the first single from his EP, "Scary Hours" (2018) and from his album, "Scorpion" (2018). The song entered at the top of the "Billboard" Hot 100 in the United States. It stayed there for 11 weeks and became his fourth number-one hit. He later broke a record when his song "Nice for What" also entered at the top, making Drake the only artist to replace their number-one entry with another number-one entry.
The song finished as the number-one song of 2018 in the United States. It is only the third song that entered at number one and topped the year-end charts in the US, after "Something About the Way You Look Tonight" by Elton John and "Shape of You" by Ed Sheeran.
Music video.
The music video began with the titles, "The budget for this video was $996,631.90. We gave it all away. Don't tell the label…"
The money was given to various people, including some fans. As of May 2018, the video has received over 581 million YouTube views.

annotations.surface_form: Something About the Way You Look Tonight
